name: Printing
content: The print command [*][SHINE]System.out.println("Hello world");[][*] prints the text "Hello world."

You can print any text you want with the command, as long as the command [*][SHINE]System.out.println("text");[][*] -i.e., System dot out dot println open parenthesis ( "the text" close parenthesis ) and semicolon ; remains unchanged.
The command below will print the text "Hello {VAR=USERNAME}!".
Programs are constructed command-by-command, where each command is placed on a new line.
